title: Fix for #1005 - fix click suppression after dragend in cases where click doesn't fire.
body:
Fixes Issue #1005 for both behavior.zoom and behavior.drag

This fixes (which we're using at appneta to fix this issue in our app for both zoom and drag) cases when code intended to suppress superfluous click events on dragend causes a later click (anywhere on the page) to be absorbed.

Since the undesired click event should fire immediately after dragend, before returning to the JS event loop, the 0ms setTimeout where we clear the handler would only ever fire after the click event.  This should also take place fast enough that most human users would never make a subsequent click before the setTimeout fires.

This is a bit hacky as noted in https://github.com/mbostock/d3/issues/1005#issuecomment-15592805, but is probably less complicated than trying to discern cases/browsers/versions where the click does and does not fire.

title: selection.insert() now accepts before argument as function
body: A minor change, but one I needed for full control of the node order inside the DOM.

title: Allow setting the type of constraint to use when dragging a brush
body:
Add a `dragConstraints` method to **brush** that excepts the following options:
- _closed_ The default and constrains the extent to be entirely within the range
- _open_ Constrians the extent to where it can can go just outside the range
- _halfopen_ Constrains the extent to where half of it can go outside the range
- _loose_ No constraints, can drag the extent well beyond the range

I specifically needed the `halfopen` setting because my graph is a list of reports and whichever report is in the center of the range is _selected_. So I needed the ability to drag the extent halfway past the range to allow for this:

I have an example of this here: http://bl.ocks.org/jisaacks/5271235 you will notice if you make a brush and drag it all the way to the left or right it will allow you to keep dragging until the beginning/end of the graph is in the center.

Currently in D3 there was no way to specify this behavior.

I added the other settings for completeness.

title: multi touch zoom for android
body: android does not supply event.scale, so d3 freezes on android multi touch input. this == ++bad. I create a new variable in zoom.js representing the on touch distance between fingers, and normalize the distance at touchmove to that for the missing scale value. works like Jesus on a weekday. nexus 7 development environment ftw. -dru

title: Updated package.json to include d3's license
body:
NPM spec allows for d3's license in the package.json, so for completeness, I added it in :)

https://npmjs.org/doc/json.html

title: adding step-middle as interpolation method
body:
I recently needed to use this functionality in a graph.  It does what it sounds like it should do, i.e. steps between two points on a line instead of before or after.

A test has also been added for the functionality.

title: Refactor d3.geom.{voronoi,quadtree}.
body:
Experimenting with the ideas discussed in #1145.  Notes:
- delaunay is deprecated by voronoi.triangles.
- hull should be refactored similarly.
- Should polygon be refactored to use accessors too?
- If so, polygon should also be consistent with voronoi in the way it supports additional functionality (area, centroid; triangles, links).
- Related to the previous point, perhaps voronoi should reuse the same voronoi diagram for all three methods (voronoi, triangles, links).

(Less important, is it a good idea to import ../svg/line?  Perhaps these default accessors should be moved to ../core/point or similar.)

title: Making pie layout work properly when a function is specified for startAngle
body: The concerned line in pie.js assumes that a number is specified for startAngle and breaks if it is a function.

title: projection.clipExtent: handle infinite coordinates.
body: Fixes issues when using d3.geo.mercator.

title: Fix small-circle clipping of lines.
body:
This corrects the handling of lines that are long enough to have two
visible or invisible endpoints, but still cross the small circle and
thus have an invisible or visible intermediate segment.

Fixes #1127.

title: Support for {selection,dispatch}.on(".foo", null).
body:
This allows all listeners with a particular name to be removed.

Fixes #880.

title: d3.{unique,distinct} method(s)
body:
When dealing with ordinal data, it would be nice to have a `d3.unique(array[, accessor])` method that returns the set of unique elements within the specified array. I'm not sure if the optional `accessor` function is necessary, but I could imagine this being useful if you wanted to find the set of unique objects that had the same attribute value.

This is somewhat similar to [`d3.nest()`](https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki/Arrays#wiki-d3_nest). 

Thoughts?

title: Removing named listeners.
body: Fixes #880, ~~although it’s a bit more extensive as #880 only refers to removal of listeners, and I’m not sure setting or retrieval is as useful~~.  Thoughts?

title: Fix for running `make clean && make -j all`.
body: This can fail due to a missing d3.js file, which is required for `node src/package.js` and `node src/component.js`.

title: Add rotation.invert.
body: Fixes #1134.

title: Implemented d3.svg.arc.cornerRadius
body:
See #1131. This implementation uses approach C for the case of large corner radius relative to arc length—i.e. using Bézier curve approximations to both align the corner start points with those of neighbouring slices and also touch the inner and outer radius, at the expense of the corners no longer being circular.

This features adds about 1.3kB to the minified library (comparing the results of `make`).

_NB. I went ahead and implemented this approach, though I'm still open to switching to the other approaches if so desired._

title: Detect polygons surrounding clip extent.
body:
Also, fix interpolation for points on the same clip edge that need interpolating the long way around.

See #1114.

title: d3.dsv support for files without headers
body:
The following patch is a minimal addition to d3.dsv to bypass the creation of the construction function, in case the file doesn't contain headers. In that case, the user is responsible for passing a construction function:

```
d3.csv("foo", callback, function(a) { return { "field1": a[0], "field2": a[1]} });
```

This might be marginally useful as well for cases where users don't want the entire dsv.

Not sure if this different API is in acceptable style, but the feature has been useful for me on occasion.

title: Improve projection.clipExtent.
body:
Still in progress: ~~correct marking of whether an intersection is an entry or exit point~~, and detection of points that lie exactly on the clip edge, which should be jittered.

I have some test cases that fail due to the above but it works quite well in general.

title: First stab at d3.geo.clipView.
body:
This is a simple stream transformation for the moment.  Note that the
clip region points should be specified in counterclockwise order as
required by d3.geom.polygon, and unlike GeoJSON, the first and last
points should not be coincident.

This is a work-in-progress; lines are not intersected at the moment!

[Example](http://bl.ocks.org/jasondavies/5082889).

title: Use setAttribute("class") instead of className.
body: Fixes #1112.

title: Fix closed rings generated by clipping.
body:
After intersecting a polygon with a clip region, it's possible for one
or more of the resulting visible segments to be a closed ring.  This
occurs when the first and last points in a segment are coincident (or
close enough to be coincident).

If the clipping algorithm attempts to rejoin these segments, first it
orders intersection points along the clip edge, and the subsequent
interpolation direction depends on this order.  However, the order of
coincident points is ambiguous, hence “flickering” may occur if the
order of two coincident swaps around, causing interpolation to alternate
between taking the longer and shorter ways around the clip edge.

See #1095.

title: bar-1 tutorial: add rule class
body: this syncs the script with the tutorial text

title: Internalize quadtree node boundaries
body: Eliminates the need to recalculate boundaries every time we are spanning (visiting) the tree.

title: Add d3.layout.voronoi.
body: A more user-friendly version of d3.geom.voronoi. Fixes #1100.
